text.0: he who just born chief god of lofty spirit by power and might became the gods protector.
text.1: before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled he o men is indra.
text.2: he who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered and set at rest the agitated mountains.
text.3: who measured out the airs wide middle region and gave the heaven support he men is indra.
text.4: who slew the dragon freed the seven rivers and drove the kine forth from the cave of vala.
text.5: begat the fire between two stones the spoiler in warriors battle he o men is indra.
text.6: by whom this universe was made to tremble who chased away the humbled brood of demons.
text.7: who like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foes riches he o men is indra.
text.8: of whom the terrible they ask where is he or verily they say of him he is not.
text.9: he sweeps away like birds the foes possessions have faith in him for he o men is indra.
text.10: stirrer to action of the poor and lowly of priest of suppliant who sings his praises.
text.11: who fairfaced favours him who presses soma with stones made ready he o men is indra.
text.12: he under whose supreme control are horses all chariots and the villages and cattle.
text.13: he who gave being to the sun and morning who leads the waters he o men is indra.
text.14: to whom two armies cry in close encounter both enemies the stronger and the weaker.
text.15: whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted each for himself he o ye men is indra.
text.16: without whose help our people never conquer whom battling they invoke to give them succour.
text.17: he of whom all this world is but the copy who shakes things moveless he o men is indra.
text.18: he who hath smitten ere they knew their danger with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners.
text.19: who pardons not his boldness who provokes him who slays the dasyu he o men is indra.
text.20: he who discovered in the fortieth autumn Śambara as he dwelt among the mountains.
text.21: who slew the dragon putting forth his vigour the demon lying there he men is indra.
text.22: who with seven guiding reins the bull the mighty set free the seven great floods to flow at pleasure.
text.23: who thunderarmed rent rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven he o ye men is indra.
text.24: even the heaven and earth bow down before him before his very breath the mountains tremble.
text.25: known as the somadrinker armed with thunder who wields the bolt he o ye men is indra.
text.26: who aids with favour him who pours the soma and him who brews it sacrificer singer.
text.27: whom prayer exalts and pouring forth of soma and this our gift he o ye men is indra.
text.28: thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation.
text.29: so may we evermore thy friends o indra speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.
